label: 上屋敷
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: The chief [residence, which] functioned as a permanent legation, where a staff of officials attended to the han's Edo business and where the daimyo was housed during his sankin kōtai stays (p. 221).  [藩、江戸、大名、参勤交代]
